# elasticstack_kibana_security_exception_list (Resource)

Creates and manages Kibana exception lists (exception containers). Exception lists are containers for related exceptions that can be associated with security detection rules.



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `description` (String) A description of the exception list.
- `name` (String) The name of the exception list.
- `type` (String) The type of exception list. Valid values are: 'detection', 'rule_default', 'endpoint', 'endpoint_trusted_apps', 'endpoint_events', 'endpoint_host_isolation_exceptions', 'endpoint_blocklists'.

### Optional

- `list_id` (String) The human-readable unique identifier for the exception list (e.g., 'my-exception-list'). If not provided, Kibana will generate one.
- `meta` (Attributes) Optional metadata about the exception list. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--meta))
- `namespace_type` (String) Determines whether the exception list is available in all Kibana spaces or just the space in which it is created. Valid values are: 'single' (only available in the space where created) or 'agnostic' (available in all spaces). Defaults to 'single'.
- `os_types` (List of String) Array of operating system types for which the exception list applies. Valid values include: 'linux', 'macos', 'windows'.
- `space_id` (String) The Kibana space ID where the exception list exists. Defaults to 'default'.
- `tags` (List of String) Array of tags to help categorize the exception list.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The unique identifier of the exception list. This is generated by Kibana.
- `version` (Number) The version of the exception list.

<a id="nestedatt--meta"></a>
### Nested Schema for `meta`

Optional:

- `additional_properties` (Map of String) Additional metadata properties as key-value pairs.
